property.name: content
property.description: This is the jinja template for hbase-env.sh file

property.name: is_hbase_system_service_launch
property.description: Should Hbase cluster started as system service. This configuration depends on use_external_hbase property. If use_external_hbase is set, then this property doesn't take effect.

property.name: yarn_hbase_system_service_queue_name
property.description: The queue that used by service check.

property.name: yarn_hbase_system_service_launch_mode
property.description: Should services are launched as sync or async.

property.name: yarn_hbase_master_cpu
property.description: Number of CPU for master container.

property.name: yarn_hbase_master_containers
property.description: Number of containers to launch for master.

property.name: yarn_hbase_regionserver_cpu
property.description: Number of CPU for regionserver container.

property.name: yarn_hbase_regionserver_containers
property.description: Number of containers to launch for regionserver.

property.name: yarn_hbase_client_cpu
property.description: Number of CPU for client container.

property.name: yarn_hbase_client_containers
property.description: Number of containers to launch for client.

property.name: yarn_hbase_heap_memory_factor
property.description: Heap memory is auto derived using this factor.

property.name: use_external_hbase
property.description: Setting true, doesn't start embedded hbase or system service hbase. Note: Admin/User need to take care of pointing right hbase-site.xml into RM/NM classpath. If system service hbase is started, then admin must clean up system service hbase before making this change.

property.name: yarn_hbase_log_level
property.description: Setting log level to hmaster and regionserver. Default to info logs. Log levels could be INFO, DEBUG, WARN
